summary:
## Mid-Autumn Festival

The Mid-Autumn Festival, also called the Moon or Mooncake Festival, is a big holiday in Chinese culture. It happens on the brightest full moon of the year, usually in September or October. People celebrate the harvest with lanterns and special cakes called mooncakes. The festival has been around for over 3,000 years and is based on a legend about a moon goddess named Chang'e. It's like a really important Chinese New Year celebration.
title: Mid-Autumn Festival
